data.name: 021_Title
data.value: Snowflakes

data.name: 018_Title
data.value: Freedom of Movement

data.name: 016_Title
data.value: Pearly Whites

data.name: 005_Title
data.value: A New Venture

data.name: 019_Title
data.value: Find the Sparklies
You've achieved the hit chain! Corbin will be thrilled!
Corbin would love for you to achieve a 1,000 hit chain. Have you got what it takes?
Yep, Corbin was thrilled!
Colleen is looking for her missing brother, Corbin. She claims that Gianni in Aurora Village may know his whereabouts.
Gianni has sent Corbin to Ivydale Glen to wash his laundry. Make sure that he is safe.
You've rescued Corbin and sent him safely home. Now to find Gianni's laundry.
You've dealt with Gianni's laundry. Return the basket to him in Aurora Village.
You've stocked the shop with a new material type. Check with the merchant to collect your bonus.
A mysterious merchant has asked that you find various materials and sell them to him. He will give you a bonus for the first new material type you sell him.
You've acquired Haley's Transmitter. She can now craft equipment for you no matter where you are in the world. From your Inventory, choose a blueprint and select the Craft option.
Avgustin has asked that you deliver a blueprint to the blacksmith in Archers' Pass in his stead, as the pass seems to be incredibly dangerous as of late.

You've met the blacksmith's daughter, Haley. She can now craft equipment from any blueprints you find. To be of further use, she has asked that you find a special device which will allow communication from anywhere in the world. Seek out a Blue Resonance Gate somewhere in Abadis Forest.
You've collected the slimy components. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
Fale wants to reinforce the Aurora guards' armor with a distilled concoction derived from (4 Slimy Spikes) and (4 Slimy Coats). You expect things will get a bit messy.
To improve the guards' weapons, Fale needs (8 Beast Spears) from the monsters roaming the valley.
You've collected the spears. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
You've collected the imp hides. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
Fale wants to improve the armor worn by the town guard. Bring him (5 Imp Hides) to help him out.
Fulfill your purpose and defeat your old comrade, General Gaius.
You've cleared the way through the mountain pass. Reach the peak to meet up with Ginger and plan your next step against General Gaius.
You've discovered the truth about yourself. Meet up with Ginger and the Elder in the hidden camp at the foot of the Everdawn Basin.
Check in with Kier at the edge of camp and assist Sanjin in restoring the Moonblood's support systems.
The General's assassins are beginning their push into the camp. Report this news to the Elder. Once the support systems are back up, the war preparations will be complete.
Meet up with the Moonblood warriors gathering at the eastern edge of the camp.
Recent volcanic activity has blocked the road. Clear the way for the Moonblood warriors.
Mount an assault against General Gaius and lead the Moonblood warriors into battle.
Enemy cannons are blocking your path. You will need to flank them if you want to destroy them.
A small child seems to be wandering around these caves by himself. Perhaps he can help you learn more about the monster attacks?

You've discovered the small village of Mudpot deep in the Cirromon Caverns. Bopo's father is dying and can only be saved by a creature called "The Lady". Explore the village to find a way to her chamber.
You've proven yourself a hero to the townspeople of Aurora. Perhaps now you can get some answers from the townsfolk.
The Mayor of Aurora has asked you to travel east into Abadis Forest and find the leader of the monsters attacking the village.

You've woken up in a small glade in the mountains with no memory of your past. An ancient magical blade, Ahrah, and its guardian, Fidget, have joined with you. With no other path to travel, the road to the east is your only option.
There is a village in the distance. Perhaps it holds some answers?
Aurora is under attack! Defeat the monsters and learn how they made it into the village.
You've discovered a beautiful yet dangerous underground world. Travel deeper to learn why those monsters attacked Aurora.
You defeated the leader of the monsters, a strange creature named Fuse, but doing so has raised more questions than answers. Report back to Mayor Bram in Aurora.
Mayor Bram suggested that you speak with a young woman named Ginger. She seems to have knowledge about these "Moonbloods" that Fuse mentioned.
The path north is being blocked by a massive wall of snow. Find a way through.
Despite the relative beauty of this snowy world, you feel uneasy as you travel north to meet up with Ginger.
While you were able to get the waters flowing again and save the valley, you were unable to save Bopo's father. You must now travel north to the Sorrowing Meadow to meet with this "Baron Kane".
You've sorted things out with Lady Tethys and she has restored the flow of mineral water. Return to Bopo in Mudpot.
With your newfound sliding ability, you can now proceed west of Mudpot and find "The Lady".
You've been told that an item beneath Mudpot can aid you in your quest.

With your help, Cora was able to drive away the demonic presence that assumed control over her husband. Kane has given you further details about the war, and opened the path to the mountains at the entrance of the graveyard.
You've found Cora's items. Return to her at the center of the Sorrowing Meadow.
Cora has asked you to retrieve four keepsakes from the abandoned mansions in each corner of the Sorrowing Meadows.
The path into the mountains is being blocked by a strange barrier. Find and speak with Baron Kane in the Sorrowing Meadow to learn how to deactivate it.
The moment you took the fatal blow, the demonic entity was destroyed and the curse was lifted. Return the box to Reed in Aurora... and make sure not to open it this time.

It would seem that Fidget unintentionally opened Reed's box. When he learned of this, Reed refused to take it back. While you now have a nice box, the demonic presence within is slowly draining your life. The only 'cure' is to let a monster kill you.
In exchange for her doll, SmoBop has given you a box that has a remarkable resemblence to what Reed was rambling about. Return the box to Reed in Aurora Village.
You've met an odd fellow named Reed. He seems to be looking for a box of some sort.
Moska believes that Sarahi may be hiding in the Hidden Cove after escaping from Denham.
You've rescued Sarahi and reunited her with Moska. The two have returned to Aurora Village.
Moska has asked that you check in on a girl in Denham, at the edge of Abadis Forest.
Denham lies in ruins, but you've discovered a note from a girl named Sarahi that is addressed to Moska. Return the note to him in Aurora Village.

data.name: 012_Title
data.value: Red Moss
SmoBop was pleased with the doll, and has given you a peculiar box in exchange.
You've aquired the necessary materials. The shopkeeper in Aurora Village should now be able to craft the Fidget doll.
The doll is now complete. Despite Fidget's absolutely terrible reference drawing, it didn't turn out half-bad. Give the doll to SmoBop in Mudpot.

SmoBop in Mudpot insists that she must have Fidget. Resisting the urge to give her the real thing, you decide to find a suitable replacement, preferably in the form of a Fidget doll. Your best bet would be the shopkeeper in Aurora Village.
The shopkeeper has agreed to craft a Fidget doll, but needs (2 Yards of Fabric), (3 Clumps of Cotton), and (1 Bottle of Dye) to complete the task.
You've found the teeth. Return them to Blop in Mudpot.
Blop has asked that you bring him (10 Rockhound Teeth) so that he may craft a new set of dentures.
You've collected the (4 Trolk Fingers). Return to Blop in Mudpot so that his honor may be restored.
To avenge Blop's fragile ego, you've agreed to collect (4 Trolk Fingers) from the shield-wielding Trolks within the caverns.
Old Gappy has asked that you find his six lost sheep. They could be anywhere in the caverns. You'll recognize them by their sparkling black wool.
You've managed to find all the lost sheep. Return them to Old Gappy in Mudpot.
You've collected some clumps of red moss. Return them to FloHop in Mudpot.
FloHop has asked that you find clumps of red moss so that she can feed her hard working husband. Apparently they only grow in the dark, under the canopies of giant red mushrooms.
To reinforce the guards' armor in Aurora Village, Fale has asked that you bring (2 Giant Rocks) and (2 Giant Cores).
You've collected the materials. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
You've found paper suitable for an autograph. While you feel a bit silly, you'll grant Moska's wish in Aurora Village.
Moska is certain the you will become a legend, and would love nothing more than to have your autograph. Now if you only had some paper...
Blop has lost his "hittin' stick" in the area below Mudpot. Retrieve his stick so he can get back to hitting things as soon as possible.
You've retrieved Blop's hittin' stick. Return it to him in Mudpot.
Blop was thrilled to have his stick back. Now the hitting can begin anew. Sadly you never stopped to ask yourself why his stick was hidden away from him in the first place.
Fale is interested in using the unique abilities of the flying electric florn creatures to improve the guards' armaments in Aurora Village. Bring him (3 Florn Tentacles) and (3 Florn Sparks).
You've collected the materials. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
You've collected the materials. Return to Fale in Aurora for your payment.
Fale would like to incorporate the properties of the Avee into his gear. Collect (6 Avee Wings) and (6 Avee Claws) from the flying creatures.

data.name: 001_Title
data.value: Better than Nothing
You've acquired a cooler that would be ideal to store some snow.
As a final goodbye to his father, Bopo has asked that you bring him some snow. There's snow in the mountains to the north, but you'll need some way to transport it back to Mudpot.
Bopo placed the snow on his father's grave, fulfilling an old promise made to him long ago.
You've collected some snow. Bring it to Bopo in Mudpot.
Oneida seems concerned about her husband, Geehan. Check in with him near the western entrance of Aurora Village.
Geehan has asked that you explore the region around his farm and search for his lost pocketwatch.
You've found the pocketwatch. Return it to Geehan in Aurora Village.

data.name: Quest_Complete
data.value: Quest Complete!

data.name: 020_Title
data.value: Lost Time

data.value: The Blacksmith

data.name: 006_Title
data.value: Out to Dry

data.name: 015_Title
data.value: A Better Fidget

data.name: 010_Title
data.value: Number One Fan

data.name: 002_Title
data.value: Taking Point

data.name: 011_Title
data.value: Over the Fence
